availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Stone (Powell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Francis Stone and Sarah Stone. Married Amanda A. Stone. Father of Armilda Stone, Greenberry Stone, Mary E. Stone, Sarah Stone, and Nancy Stone. Farmer in Estill County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Powell County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p 64; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 15; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct 3, p. 5; Francis Vincent, ed., Vincent’s Semi-Annual United States Register: A Work in Which the Principal Events of Every Half-Year Occurring in the United States Are Recorded, Each Arranged Under the Day of its Date. This Volume Contains the Events Transpiring Between the 1st of January and 1st of July, 1860 (Philadelphia, PA: Francis Vincent, 1860), p. 243; KYR-0001-029-0545; KYR-0001-004-0463.
